<<<<<<< HEAD
A brief relation and exact map of the harbour of New-Castle near Tinmouth-Barre, since December 1672 when eight ships wee overwhelmed by the freshes, of which six were (as not lying difficult) removed and cleared the first month, the other two being great and deep laden, sunk in the best of the harbour, were blown up with gun-powder a few months after, with some particulars of what change happened that harbour thereupon to this present August following. Custis, Edmond.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed for the author Edmond Custis, London : 1673.
Caption title. Imperfect: lacks the map. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
=======
A brief relation and exact map of the harbour of New-Castle near Tinmouth-Barre, since December 1672 when eight ships wee overwhelmed by the freshes, of which six were (as not lying difficult) removed and cleared the first month, the other two being great and deep laden, sunk in the best of the harbour, were blown up with gun-powder a few months after, with some particulars of what change happened that harbour thereupon to this present August following. Custis, Edmond.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed for the author Edmond Custis, London : 1673.

the author Edmond Custis
